Package net.xqhs.flash.core

Interface Entity<P extends Entity<?>>

  • Type Parameters:
    P - - the type of the entity that can contain (be the context of) this entity.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Agent, AgentShard, ConfigurableEntity<P>, MessagingShard, Pylon, RunnableEntity<P>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractMessagingShard, AbstractNameBasedMessagingShard, AgentPingPong, AgentShardCore, AgentShardGeneral, BootSimple.AgentTest, CentralGUI, CentralMonitoringAndControlEntity, CompositeAgent, ControlShard, DefaultPylonImplementation, EchoAgent, GUIBoard, GuiShard, IOShard, JavaAgent, LocalPylon, LocalPylon.SimpleLocalMessaging, MonitoringShard, MonitoringTestShard, Node, PingBackTestComponent, PingTestComponent, SwingGuiShard, WebSocketMessagingShard, WebSocketPylon, WebSocketServerEntity
    public interface Entity<P extends Entity<?>>
    An element in the deployment, be it a support infrastructure, an agent, a shard, etc. It needs to have some sort of persistent presence in the system, and therefore it has a life-cycle that can be started, stopped, and checked upon.

    It may have a name that is unique in the system.

    Entities can be placed one in the context of one another, but one entity can have only one type of context that directly contains it (albeit it may run in the context of multiple entities of the same type).

    Access control policy

    An object that has a reference to an Entity instance is able to control that entity, i.e. it is able to start it, stop it, and change its context.

    Objects that need to call methods in an entity (such as other entities in this entity's context) should do so through a proxy. The proxy to an entity should be obtained by calling its asContext() method. All proxies to entities should implement Entity.EntityProxy. The workflow should be as follows:

    • an object C authorized to control entities E and S has a reference to entities E and S.
    • object C calls E.asContext() to obtain a proxy pE to entity E.
    • object C calls S.addContext(pE) in order to integrate S in the context of E.

    Loading

    Normally, before being started, Entity instances are created by Loader instances.

    It is recommended that an entity receives its configuration via a MultiTreeMap. This can be done via a constructor which takes a MultiTreeMap as argument, or using a default constructor and a method that takes a MultiTreeMap as argument. For the latter, the ConfigurableEntity interface can be used.

    Author:
    andreiolaru
    See Also:
    RunnableEntity

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  Entity.EntityIndex
      An index of all local entities, allowing the retrieval of a string in the form of type":"name"."index for any entity, just by providing a reference to the entity.
      static interface  Entity.EntityProxy<C extends Entity<?>>
      Marker interface for classes that provide a proxy to an entity which is an instance of C.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        boolean start()
        Starts the life-cycle of the entity. If this goes well, from this moment on the entity should be executing normally.

        The method must guarantee that once it has been started successfully, the entity can immediately begin receiving events, even if those events will not be processed immediately.

        The method should return immediately. It is not guaranteed that when the method returned, the entity has successfully started; this should checked using isRunning().

        Returns:
        true if the entity was started without error. false otherwise.

      • stop

        boolean stop()
        Stops the entity. After this method succeeds, the entity should not be executing any more.
        Returns:
        true if the entity was stopped without error. false otherwise.

      • isRunning

        boolean isRunning()
        Queries the entity to check if it has completed its startup and is fully functional. The entity is running after it has fully start()ed and until it is stop()ed.
        Returns:
        true if the entity is currently running.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Retrieves the name (or other identification) of the entity, if any.
        Returns:
        the name, if any has been given; null otherwise.

      • addContext

        boolean addContext​(Entity.EntityProxy<P> context)
        Creates a link from a subordinate entity to an entity containing it in some way.

        This method should be idempotent (when called with the same argument): adding the same context multiple times (with no removeContext(net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<P>) operations in between) should have no effect.

        Parameters:
        context - - a reference to the higher-level entity.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful. false otherwise.

      • removeContext

        boolean removeContext​(Entity.EntityProxy<P> context)
        Removes the link from a subordinate entity to an entity containing it in some way.
        Parameters:
        context - - a reference to the higher-level entity.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful. false otherwise.

      • addGeneralContext

        boolean addGeneralContext​(Entity.EntityProxy<? extends Entity<?>> context)
        Creates a link from a subordinate entity to an entity containing it in some way.

        This method should only be used (as opposed to addContext(net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<P>) in the following cases:

        • when a context other than the direct parent of the entity is added; or
        • when the caller cannot know the exact type of the entity's parent; and
        • passing as argument an entity of the appropriate type is not possible.

        It is the responsibility of the called object to verify the correctness of the argument.

        The recommended implementation for this method is one that calls addContext(EntityProxy) after casting the argument to the appropriate type, optionally catching ClassCastException and returning false if such an exception occurs.

        This method should be idempotent (when called with the same argument): adding the same context multiple times (with no removeContext(net.xqhs.flash.core.Entity.EntityProxy<P>) operations in between) should have no effect.

        Parameters:
        context - - a reference to the higher-level entity.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful. false otherwise.

      • removeGeneralContext

        boolean removeGeneralContext​(Entity.EntityProxy<? extends Entity<?>> context)
        Removes the from a subordinate entity to the specified context.
        Parameters:
        context - - a reference to the higher-level entity.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful. false otherwise.

      • asContext

        <C extends Entity<P>> Entity.EntityProxy<C> asContext()
        Returns a proxy to this entity.
        Type Parameters:
        C - should be the actual class of this entity.
        Returns:
        a proxy to the entity, implementing Entity.EntityProxy parameterized with the class of this entity.
